oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of libraries, the Calvary Cemetery entrance, composing staff of The Banner newspaper, and a group of football players with a church group. Nashville Banner, 1932 November 13.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Graham, Claire; Miller, Suzanna; Fleming, Lillian D.
Nashville Banner
Libraries; Group portraits; athletes; Religion; Children
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of libraries, the Calvary Cemetery entrance on Murfreesboro Road, composing staff of The Banner newspaper, and a group of high school football players with the Edgefield Cumberland Presbyterian Church. The athletes are from Central, Hume-Fogg, and Isaac Litton High Schools. Libraries pictured are at Bailey Junior High, Buena Vista Junior High, the Brown Opportunity School, Washington Junior High School, and the East and West branches of the Nashville Carnegie Library. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
